category-def.name: Tools
category-def.label: Tools
category-def.description: Useful Tools for Eclipse - Bundles 'Multi Clipboard', 'QuickREx' and 'tiny HTML Tools' In case you do not want all plugins contained in this feature to be installed, select the ones you want separately in the update manager.

category-def.name: Multi Clipboard
category-def.label: Multi Clipboard
category-def.description: Multi Clipboard gives you a clipboard for text- and source-code editor contents that holds multiple entries. You can collect some snippets by adding them to the Multi Clipboard and then paste any of them to where you need them. You can configure the plug-in to save the contents of your Multi Clipboard to a file when Eclipse is closed. Contents are then reloaded when Eclipse is opened. You can even configure the plug-in to enable editing the contents of the Multi Clipboard.

category-def.name: tiny HTML Tools
category-def.label: tiny HTML Tools
category-def.description: tiny HTML Tools are just what the name suggests: A set of very small but useful actions added to the Eclipse text-editor which let you write simple formatted HTML-contents easier.

category-def.name: QuickREx
category-def.label: QuickREx
category-def.description: QuickREx is a tool to test, play with, and use Regular Expressions. It offers evaluation as-you-type and highlighting of matches, navigation through matches and navigation through groups in matches as well as grepping (extracting) matches. You can save regular expressions and test-texts that they are matched against into a persistent store for later reference. You can also load file-contents as test-texts.

category-def.name: XPath-Developer
category-def.label: XPath-Developer
category-def.description: XPath-Developer is a tool to test, play with, and use XPath Expressions. It offers evaluation as-you-type or on-demand and allows to choose the output-type. It also offers TAB-Completion. You can save expressions into a persistent store for later reference.
